Name.BusinessNameLine1: SOCIETY FOR PROTECTION OF NH FOREST

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE SOCIETY FOR THE PROTECTION OF NEW HAMPSHIRE FORESTS WAS FOUNDED IN 1901 TO PROTECT THE STATE'S MOST IMPORTANT LANDSCAPES AND PROMOTE THE WISE USE OF ITS NATURAL RESOURCES.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE SOCIETY FOR THE PROTECTION OF NEW HAMPSHIRE FORESTS WAS FOUNDED IN 1901 TO PROTECT THE STATE'S MOST IMPORTANT LANDSCAPES AND PROMOTE THE WISE USE OF ITS NATURAL RESOURCES.
IRS990.Description: LAND MANAGEMENT THE SOCIETY FOR THE PROTECTION OF NEW HAMPSHIRE FORESTS STEWARDS 167 FOREST RESERVATIONS TOTALING NEARLY 48,500 ACRES. IN FY2010 WE HELD INTENSIVE WORK DAYS AND/OR FIELD TRIPS AT 14 SPNHF RESERVATIONS; HARVESTED 1.65 MILLION BOARD FEET OF SAW LOGS AND 22,000 TONS OF LOW GRADE WOOD FROM 7 TIMBER SALES; ORGANIZED A VOLUNTEER WEEK FOR UPGRADING OF TRAILS ON MT MONADNOCK WITH NH STATE PARKS; HOSTED 14,000 VISITORS TO THE ROCKS ESTATE AND BRETZFELDER PARK IN BETHLEHEM; HARVESTED 5,500 CHRISTMAS TREES FROM THE ROCKS CHRISTMAS TREE FARM AND PLANTED 7,400 NEW CHRISTMAS TREES AT THE FARM; OPENED THE NEW MAPLE CENTER SUGAR HOUSE AND MAPLE MUSEUM AT THE ROCKS ESTATE; INTIATED MAJOR PLANNING EFFORT FOR RENOVATIONS AT THE CONCORD CONSERVATION CENTER FACILITY.

Activity2.Description: LAND PROTECTION THE FOREST SOCIETY CONSERVED 5,516 ACRES THROUGH 29 LAND PROTECTION PROJECTS. AMONG THEM 7 WERE NEW FEE OWNED FOREST RESERVATIONS OR ADDITIONS TO EXISTING RESERVATIONS, WHILE 16 WERE CONSERVATION EASEMENTS ON LAND OWNED BY OTHER INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS. IN ADDITION THE FOREST SOCIETY ALSO MONITORS MORE THAN 750 EASEMENTS ON OVER 118,000 ACRES.

Activity3.Description: EDUCATION, OUTREACH AND MEMBERSHIP KEY ACCOMPLISHMENT INCLUDE CONTINUED REVAMPING THE FOREST SOCIETY'S APPROACH TO VOLUNTEER ENGAGEMENT; TRAINED DOZENS OF NEW VOLUNTEER LAND STEWARDS; WORKED WITH VOLUNTEERS TO IMPROVE RECREATION STEWARDSHIP; INCREASED EARNED MEDIA COVERAGE THROUGH NEWS RELEASES, PUBLIC SERVICE ANNOUNCEMENTS, NEWSPAPER COLUMNS, RADIO PIECES, AND SPECIAL FEATURES; ORGANIZED AND DELIVERED DOZENS OF FIELD-BASED EDUCATION PROGRAMS THAT REACHED HUNDREDS OF PEOPLE; INCREASED NUMBER OF ENEWSLETTER RECIPIENTS BY 25%; LAUNCHED FOREST SOCIETY ON FACEBOOK AND MAINTAINED OUR WEBSITE AND QUARTERLY PUBLICATION OF FOREST NOTES MAGAZINE WHILE CUTTING COSTS SUBSTANTIALLY.

ActivityOther.Description: POLICY THE FOREST SOCIETY LOBBIES STATE ELECTED OFFICIALS IN CONCORD, NH AND OUR FEDERAL DELEGATION IN WASHINGTON. THERE ARE TWO STAFF MEMBERS WHO ALLOCATE TIME TO LOBBYING, AND MOST OF THAT TIME IS SPENT LOBBYING STATE LEGISLATORS ON BEHALF THE FOREST SOCIETY'S POSITIONS ON SPECIFIC PIECES OF LEGISLATION INTRODUCED. THE STATE LEGISLATURE MEETS FROM JANUARY TO JUNE EACH YEAR. MOST OF THE TIME SPENT LOBBYING BY THE ORGANIZATION'S STAFF IS WITHIN THESE SIX MONTH SESSIONS. THE FOREST SOCIETY LOBBIES SPECIFICALLY ON BILLS RELATING TO FORESTRY, WATER QUALITY, AIR QUALITY LAND CONSERVATION AND GROWTH MANAGEMENT. CONSERVATION PLANNING CONSERVATION PLANNING STAFF WORKS WITH THE FOREST SOCIETY'S CONSERVATION PARTNERS TO CREATE IN-DEPTH MAPPING TO HIGHLIGHT KEY LAND PROTECTION PRIORITIES AROUND THE STATE. IN FY2010 PLANNING FOCUSED ON THE DEVELOPMENT OF A STRATEGIC CONSERVATION PLAN FOR THE 1,600 SQUARE MILE LAKES REGION OF NEW HAMPSHIRE, AS WELL AS CONTRACT WORK TO UPDATE A KEY DATASET ON CRITICAL GROUNDWATER RESOURCES AVAILABLE FOR FUTHER DRINKING WATER SUPPLIES.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: THE FOREST SOCIETY LOBBIES STATE ELECTED OFFICIALS IN CONCORD, NH AND OUR FEDERAL DELAGATION IN WASHINGTON, DC. THERE ARE TWO STAFF MEMBERS WHO ALLOCATE TIME TO LOBBYING, AND MOST OF THAT TIME IS SPENT LOBBYING STATE LEGISLATORS ON BEHALF OF THE FOREST SOCIETY'S POSITIONS ON SPECIFIC PIECES OF LEGISLATION INTRODUCED. THE STATE LEGISLATURE MEETS FROM JANUARY TO JUNE EACH YEAR. MOST OF THE TIME SPENT LOBBYING BY THE ORGANIZATION'S STAFF IS WITHIN THESE SIX MONTH SESSIONS. THE FOREST SOCIETY LOBBIES SPECIFICALLY ON BILLS RELATING TO FORESTRY, WATER QUALITY, AIR QUALITY, LAND CONSERVATION AND GROWTH MANAGEMENT.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 1, PART II, LINE 9
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: PERMANENT LAND HOLDINGS INCLUDE CONSERVATION EASEMENTS PURCHASED BY THE FOREST SOCIETY. CONSERVATION EASEMENTS ARE INTANGIBLE ASSETS COMPRISED OF LISTED RIGHTS AND/OR RESTRICTIONS OVER THE OWNED PROPERTY THAT ARE CONVEYED BY THE OWNER TO THE SOCIETY IN ORDER TO PROTECT THE PROPERTY AS A SIGNIFICANT NATURAL AREA. CONSERVATION EASEMENTS ARE RECORDED AT THE LOWER OF COST OR MARKET VALUE. THE VALUE OF EASEMENTS DONATED DURING THE YEAR ENDED APRIL 30, 2010 AND LISTED IN NOTE 1 OF THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS IS 2,878,500.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XI, LINE 8

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: MAJOR PLANNING EFFORT FOR RENOVATIONS AT THE CONCORD CONSERVATION CENTER FACILITY.

POLICY THE FOREST SOCIETY LOBBIES STATE ELECTED OFFICIALS IN CONCORD, NH AND OUR FEDERAL DELEGATION IN WASHINGTON. THERE ARE TWO STAFF MEMBERS WHO ALLOCATE TIME TO LOBBYING, AND MOST OF THAT TIME IS SPENT LOBBYING STATE LEGISLATORS ON BEHALF THE FOREST SOCIETY'S POSITIONS ON SPECIFIC PIECES OF LEGISLATION INTRODUCED. THE STATE LEGISLATURE MEETS FROM JANUARY TO JUNE EACH YEAR. MOST OF THE TIME SPENT LOBBYING BY THE ORGANIZATION'S STAFF IS WITHIN THESE SIX MONTH SESSIONS. THE FOREST SOCIETY LOBBIES SPECIFICALLY ON BILLS RELATING TO FORESTRY, WATER QUALITY, AIR QUALITY LAND CONSERVATION AND GROWTH MANAGEMENT. CONSERVATION PLANNING CONSERVATION PLANNING STAFF WORKS WITH THE FOREST SOCIETY'S CONSERVATION PARTNERS TO CREATE IN-DEPTH MAPPING TO HIGHLIGHT KEY LAND PROTECTION PRIORITIES AROUND THE STATE. IN FY2010 PLANNING FOCUSED ON THE DEVELOPMENT OF A STRATEGIC CONSERVATION PLAN FOR THE 1,600 SQUARE MILE LAKES REGION OF NEW HAMPSHIRE, AS WELL AS CONTRACT WORK TO UPDATE A KEY DATASET ON CRITICAL GROUNDWATER RESOURCES AVAILABLE FOR FUTHER DRINKING WATER SUPPLIES.
THE SOCIETY FOR THE PROTECTION OF NEW HAMPSHIRE FORESTS IS A NON-PROFIT MEMBERSHIP ORGANIZATION THAT CURRENTLY HAS 10,000 MEMBERS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: ELECTION OF MEMBERS AND THEIR RIGHTS
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE MEMBERS ELECT THE BOARD SECRETARY AT THEIR ANNUAL MEETING. THE CANDIDATE FOR BOARD SECRETARY IS RECOMMENDED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: DECISIONS SUBJECT TO APPROVAL OF MEMBERS
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE MEMBERS ELECT THE BOARD SECRETARY AT THEIR ANNUAL MEETING. THE CANDIDATE FOR BOARD SECRETARY IS RECOMMENDED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: ORGANIZATION'S PROCESS USED TO REVIEW FORM 990
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE BOARD'S AUDIT COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE 990 AND 990-T IN DETAIL AT A COMMITTEE MEETING. ONCE THE COMMITTEE IS SATISFIED THAT THE FORMS ARE COMPLETE THEY ARE FORWARDED TO THE ENTIRE BOARD FOR REVIEW. A BOARD VOTE IS TAKEN TO ACCEPT THE FORMS AND DIRECT STAFF TO FILE THEM.

ANNUALLY OUR TRUSTEES ARE ASKED TO SIGN A FORM ABOUT THEIR POTENTIAL CONFLICTS, IF ANY. IN ADDITION TO FILLING OUT THE FORM, THE PROCESS REMINDS TRUSTEES OF OUR POLICY. WHEN POTENTIAL TRUSTEES ARE ASKED TO CONSIDER JOINING THE BOARD, THEY'RE GIVE THE "ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES" DOCUMENT WHICH OUTLINES BOTH THE RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE INDIVIDUAL TRUSTEE AND THE BOARD AS A WHOLE, INCLUDING CONFLICT OF INTEREST. IT ALSO INSTRUCTS BOARD MEMBERS TO READ AND BE CONVERSANT WITH NH ATTORNEY GENERAL'S "GUIDEBOOK FOR NEW HAMPSHIRE CHARITABLE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS."

THE PRESIDENT/FORESTER (CEO) IS THE ONLY OFFICER OR KEY EMPLOYEE WHO IS PAID. THE COMPENSATION FOR THE PRESIDENT/FORESTER IS SET BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AFTER A PROCESS OF REVIEW BY BOTH A SUB-COMMITTEE APPOINTED BY THE CHAIR AND BY THE FULL BOARD. PERIODICALLY SALARIES OF OTHER NONPROFIT CEO'S ARE REVIEWED FOR COMPARISON. THE PRESIDENT/FORESTER PROVIDE ANNUAL GOALS AND A SELF-EVALUATION. THE BOARD CHAIR SUMMARIZES THE DELIBERATIONS OF THE BOARD IN A LETTER TO THE PRESIDENT/FORESTER.
COMPENSATION FOR THE VICE PRESIDENTS (KEY EMPLOYEES) IS SET BY THE PRESIDENT/FORESTER. PERIODICALLY SALARIES OF OTHER NON-PROFIT SENIOR STAFF ARE REVIEWED FOR COMPARISON.

FINANCIAL STATEMENTS FOR THE MOST CURRENT THREE YEARS ARE AVAILABLE ON OUR WEBSITE, OR BY REQUESTING COPIES FROM THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE. THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE PROVIDED TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS. THEY AREN'T AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.
